intro: Ormosia faroensis, commonly known as the Faroe Islands orchid, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to the Faroe Islands and is characterized by its delicate, orchid-like flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. Ormosia faroensis is adapted to the cool, moist climate of its native habitat and thrives in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
